intro: Fagara foliolosa, commonly known as the leafy fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. Fagara foliolosa produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red or orange berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting habits.
